byline.original: By MICHAEL J. de la MERCED
byline.contributor: Matthew Goldstein, Mark Scott and Emily Steel contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Charter is expected to announce on Tuesday a $55 billion deal for its larger rival and an approximately $10 billion takeover of a smaller competitor, Bright House Networks.

headline.print_headline: Cable TV Merger Signals a Shift in the Industry
headline.main: Charter Deal for Time Warner Cable Signals Shift in TV Industry

snippet: Charter is expected to announce on Tuesday a $55 billion deal for its larger rival and an approximately $10 billion takeover of a smaller competitor, Bright House Networks.
abstract: Charter Communications will buy Time Warner Cable for $55 billion, as well as Bright House Networks for $10 billion, creating cable television powerhouse and signalling consolidating shift in industry; deals make Charter strong and prominent rival to Comcast.
